comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Probably en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Albert_de_Courville NYT of February 14, 1916 select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FB0C16FC345C1373... reports that he was the manager of the London Hippodrome and anxious to acquire the Century Theatre in New York.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: He was also in the news in May, 1927, the date marked on the negative, when he married Edith Kelly Gould, the ex-wife of Frank Jay Gould, son of railroad tycoon Jay Gould. news.google.com/newspapers?nid=2206&dat=19270526&.... Both Frank J. Gould and Edith Kelly Gould are pictured elsewhere in the Bain collection. Here is one from 1913: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3220582450/ de Courville would have been 29 in 1916, and 40 in 1927, so I am guessing this picture dates from 1916 or thereabouts.
